page.title: 02UPWALTHAM ESTATE
page.content: About one third of this downland estate is in the designated area. The estate is about 800 acres of rolling downland providimg grazing for 1000 sheep of Dorset Horn 3/4 cross Mule. The areas not grazed by sheep are used for wheat and barley, hay, bag silage and turnips for the sheep. In the designated area there are three flint cottages:- "Mallowes" whre the farm manager and his wife live, and a pair of cottages known as "Droke Cottages" where two farm workers live. All of these people keep chickens, which are at present in danger from the foxes even in daylight.
